intro: Pityrodia lepidota, commonly known as the silver-leafed mistflower, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale blue flowers that appear in clusters, often during the cooler months. Its leaves are covered in a fine, silvery wax, giving it a distinctive appearance. Pityrodia lepidota is typically found in heathlands and open woodlands, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
